=== [[Talk:ATP World Tour records#rfc_ACF188F|Talk:ATP World Tour records]] expired 2016-03-02 06:01 ===
* Id: ACF188F
* User: Navops47
* Date: 2016-02-01 05:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|702708742|SOC 702708742}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|707860473|SOC 707860473}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am proposing that this article should be '''deleted''' as we currently have two other articles that already cover records for the most important time periods in tennis history from the beginning in 1877 and from 1968 .

* [[Overall tennis records – Men's Singles]] > covers entire period of tennis records (1877 onward) 
* [[Tennis records of the Open Era – men's singles]] > covers Open Era records (1968 onward)

This article covers the period from 1972 onward when the ATP came into existence however the men's tour was officially known as the [[Grand Prix tennis circuit]] from 1970 to 1989. The original discussion about this articles scope was outlined by [[User:Wolbo]] in which he stated. "At the time I was not greatly enthusiastic about the creation of [[Tennis records of the Open Era – men's singles]] given the apparent overlap with this article and the additional effort required to maintain both. Now that both articles exist side-by-side and share about 90% of the content it makes sense to evaluate the scope of these articles. The scope of this article, especially with its current name, is not always clear and can be interpreted to mean either:

A. all records since the creation of the ATP (September 1972)<br>
B. all records which are recognized and listed by the ATP (on their website)<br> 
C. all records since the creation of the ATP Tour (in 1990) or the ATP World Tour (in 2009)<br> 

This ambiguity leads to occasional confusion and edit warring. The current situation, with one article covering the entire history and two others covering almost the same period, seems less than optimal. My proposal is therefore to change the content scope of this article from the creation of the ATP (1972) to the creation of the ATP Tour (1990). That gives a better coverage of the milestones in tennis history, solves the issue of the 90% duplication between this and the Open Era article and better matches the content with the title of the article. Thoughts?"

The previous discussion above opened this debate further with some editors including myself preferring that we just have the 2 articles Overall & Open Era and that we should delete it, it was also suggested by [[User:Fyunck(click)|Fyunck(click)]] that we should move this discussion into a formal RFC with three available options below which I am doing now.

*''Option 1''. Do we delete this article and re-direct to the Open Era article?
*''Option 2''. Do we keep this article as it is now? 
*''Option 3''. Do we change this article to reflect only records from 1990 when the ATP took full control of the men's tour?

Editors are most welcome to add your comments, thoughts, etc, below.--[[User:Navops47|Navops47]] ([[User talk:Navops47|talk]]) 05:48, 1 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Standard offer#rfc_EABE204|Wikipedia talk:Standard offer]] expired 2016-03-02 18:02 ===
* Id: EABE204
* User: Coffee

* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As this is essentially a ''de facto'' guideline at this point, I think it's high time that this essay be promoted to an ''actual'' guideline. Don't think it changes the use of this much, but it does seem that it's appropriate to label standard consensus backed practices as such. Hopefully, you all agree. <small style="color:#999;white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:lightgrey 0.3em 0.3em 0.15em;">&mdash; [[User:Coffee|<big style="color:#ffa439">Coffee</big>]] // [[user talk:Coffee|<font color="#009900">have a cup</font>]] // [[Special:Contributions/Coffee|<font color="#4682b4">beans</font>]] // </small> 12:58, 2 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:European Graduate School#rfc_840400D|Talk:European Graduate School]] expired 2016-03-02 19:02 ===
* Id: 840400D
* User: Claudioalv
* Date: 2016-03-01 01:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|707665847|ECON 707665847}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|707679911|UNSORTED 707679911}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|707948039|ECON 707948039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|708055059|UNSORTED 708055059}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Is the EGS Accreditation section accurate? Does the information are correct and/or updated?

'''RfC: Is the U.S. accreditation section accurate?'''

I am writing here since it is my understandig that the user "JzG, Guy" is the only administrator who is able to make decision. Even if there is another administrator with a different point of view [Vanjagenjie}, "JzG/Guy"makes the final decision whether or not edit the EGS article
"JzG/Guy" does not like the Maltese accreditation, so it would be not possible to have the EGS article amendend. By doing so, "JzG/Only/Guy" editor has never explained the reason of denying our request. I am asking that other administrators can check what I am writing and I politely request an explanation.
Therefore, below I am posting again the contributions with verifiable and external sources any administrator can check. 

European Accreditation
European Graduate School is a European School headquartered in Switzerland. European Graduate School received the E.U. Accreditation on April 27, 2015 through the Maltese Accreditaion Body "National Commission for Further and Higher Education". The Maltese Accreditation Office recently updated their website with a list of accredited school, and between these appears the European Graduate School <ref></ref>http://ncfhe.gov.mt/en/register/Pages/list_hei.aspx<ref></ref>. Not stating anything about the E.U. Accreditation is misleading because Wikipedia readers think E.U. has no accreditation even if I provided sources of the Accrediation.

U.S. Accreditation
Michigan State info: Why does Wikipedia EGS article host on a misleading external link which does not have anything to do with the Michigan Department of Education? The current information is based on a link of Arab British Accademy for Higher Education and does not come from Michigan Department of Education. In particular, by reading the EGS Wikipedia article: "The State of Michigan Civil Service Commission states that degrees from the EGS "will not be accepted...to satisfy educational requirements indicated on job specifications". This statement is based on the external link website </ref>[http://www.abahe.co.uk/Non-accreditedSchools_78090_7.pdf)</ref>; [1] that does not have anything to do with the Michigan state.
 Indeed, the official Michigan state website is the following:<ref></ref> http://www.michigan.gov/documents/Non-accreditedSchools_78090_7.pdf<ref></ref>. By clicking on that link, does not appear the EGS as a non-accredited school. Therefore, I politely request to remove X (The State of Michigan Civil Service Commission states that degrees from the EGS "will not be accepted...to satisfy educational requirements indicated on job specifications").

Moreover, I request that the current "Accreditation in the United States" would be also removed for the following reasons. European Graduate School is a European University (and not a U.S. School). In other words, applicant students are aware they are applying to a European University, therefore is not correct that the majority of information contained on Wikipedia is based on a U.S. Accreditation. Lastly, I do not find correct the the article contain the following information: "degrees from the EGS are not currently recognized by many state education authorities in the United States". In fact, only two States appear to not recognize them, meanwhile no reference to the remaining 48 States is made. I assume that 48 States recognize EGS degrees so it is not correct that information. Therefore, please change X ["degrees from the EGS are not currently recognized by many state education authorities in the United States"] in Y [48 States recognize EGS degrees and two States (Texas and Maine) don't.]
In addition, in other U.S. states EGS graduates are being hired for U.S. faculty positions (for example, at Georgetown University,[4] New York University,[5] and Princeton University[6][7]). Therefore, why Wikipedia article host only the negative statements and not the positive ones?

Lastly, I provided that the Maine and Texas information are outdated. In fact,  the U.S. Council for Higher Education Accreditation                         <ref></ref> http://www.cheainternational.org/intdb/display1.asp?ID=c95<ref></ref> recognizes the Maltese Accreditation Body (National Commission for Further and Higher Education). The Maltese Accreditation Institute provided Licence no. 2015-007 to European Graduate School on April 27, 2015. As I wrote before, National Commission for Further and Higher Education updated their website confirming that EGS is an accredited school <ref></ref>http://ncfhe.gov.mt/en/register/Pages/list_hei.aspx<ref></ref> . The License is valid from April 2015 to April 2020. 

Can a different administrator (from JzG/Only/Guy) update the EGS with these accurate information?  [[User:Claudioalv|Claudioalv]] ([[User talk:Claudioalv|talk]]) 01:55, 1 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:European Graduate School#rfc_B140E4F|Talk:European Graduate School]] expired 2016-03-02 20:02 ===
* Id: B140E4F
* User: Claudioalv
* Date: 2016-03-01 01:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|707887974|HIST 707887974}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|707957030|HIST 707957030}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am writing here since it is my understandig that the user "JzG, Guy" is the only administrator who is able to make decision. Even if there is another administrator with a different point of view [Vanjagenjie}, "JzG/Guy"makes the final decision whether or not edit the EGS article

Therefore, please change X ["degrees from the EGS are not currently recognized by many state education authorities in the United States"] in Y [48 States recognize EGS degrees and two States (Texas and Maine) don't.]
In addition, in other U.S. states EGS graduates are being hired for U.S. faculty positions (for example, at Georgetown University,[4] New York University,[5] and Princeton University[6][7]). Therefore, why Wikipedia article host only the negative statements and not the positive ones?

Lastly, I provided that the Maine and Texas information are outdated. In fact,  the U.S. Council for Higher Education Accreditation [http://www.cheainternational.org/intdb/display1.asp?ID=c95] recognizes the Maltese Accreditation Body (National Commission for Further and Higher Education). The Maltese Accreditation Institute provided Licence no. 2015-007 to European Graduate School on April 27, 2015. As I wrote before, National Commission for Further and Higher Education updated their website confirming that EGS is an accredited school [http://ncfhe.gov.mt/en/register/Pages/list_hei.aspx] . The License is valid from April 2015 to April 2020. 

Can a different administrator (from JzG/Only/Guy) update the EGS with these accurate information?  [[User:Claudioalv|Claudioalv]] ([[User talk:Claudioalv|talk]]) 01:55, 1 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Motorcycling/Conventions#rfc_4440D35|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Motorcycling/Conventions]] expired 2016-03-02 21:02 ===
* Id: 4440D35
* User: Dennis Bratland
* Date: 2016-02-01 20:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|702816944|SCI 702816944}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|702816946|SOC 702816946}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|702816951|STYLE 702816951}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|702816953|POLICY 702816953}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|702816955|PROP 702816955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|707966164|SCI 707966164}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|707966168|SOC 707966168}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|707966170|STYLE 707966170}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|707966172|POLICY 707966172}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|707966176|PROP 707966176}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[:Category:Wikipedia information pages|information page]] '''[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Motorcycling/Conventions]]''' has been evolving over the last few years, as our version of [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Automobiles/Conventions]]. We filched a lot of material from that page, though the motorcycling conventions are not subordinate to the automobile conventions. We often follow their example because wider consensus exists, and some consistency between related projects is desirable. It has been a while since these conventions were discussed, and they have changed in the meantime with little discussion. They have never been officially adopted by the Motorcycling Project, though they have been listed on [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Motorcycling]] with no objections.

The goals of this RfC are to:

#Ensure the conventions to not overstep any Wikipedia-wide [[WP:Policies and guidelines|Policies and guidelines]].
#Remove any parts which lack consensus.
#Correct any egregious errors or contradictions.
#Receive input from non-motorcycling readers and editors, to help make the topic and project accessible to all
#Establish consensus for the conventions.

Beyond that, all changes and commentary are welcome. It might be best to hold off any major deletions until a lot of participants have had a chance to see the starting version of the conventions page, instead using inline notes, highlights, and discussion here on this talk page. --[[User:Dennis Bratland|Dennis Bratland]] ([[User talk:Dennis Bratland|talk]]) 20:13, 1 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Veganism#rfc_8C8875D|Talk:Veganism]] expired 2016-03-03 01:02 ===
* Id: 8C8875D
* User: Esquivalience
* Date: 2016-03-02 02:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|707849122|RELI 707849122}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|708000814|RELI 708000814}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have closed [[Talk:Veganism/Archive 14#RfC: Should the definition at the start of the lead of Veganism contain the wording, 'and an associated philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals'?|the RfC]] on whether the first sentence should include, change, or remove "the [[commodity status of animals]]", with a consensus to perform the following: <blockquote>edit the first sentence to mention the main belief ("philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals" or similar) of ethical veganism as a belief that is not always, but ''may'' be followed by vegans.</blockquote> There is no consensus to change "the commodity status of animals" itself. This means that the first sentence should not include the rejection of the commodity status of animals as a belief of veganism generally, but as a belief that ''may'' also be adopted by vegans. The justification for this close is covered in the RfC's closing statement.

The following modifications to the first sentence were proposed in the RfC. This second RfC will decide how the first sentence should be modified. Any proposals for an alternative wording should be started in a separate level-3 section and include "the [[commodity status of animals]]" or similar as there is no consensus to change this. '''''[[User:Esquivalience|<span style="color: #33BBFF; font-family:Lato, monospace'">Esquivalience</span>]]'' <sup>[[User talk:Esquivalience|<span style="color:#00B88A;">t</span>]]</sup>''' 02:53, 2 March 2016 (UTC)}}

This should be easy to verify. === [[Talk:9/11 conspiracy theories#rfc_BA2BD61|Talk:9/11 conspiracy theories]] expired 2016-03-03 23:01 ===
* Id: BA2BD61
* User: Prokaryotes
* Date: 2016-02-02 22:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|703007897|HIST 703007897}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|708150026|HIST 708150026}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article has multiple issues, among them the lack of explaining the actual conspiracy theories in the background section. The background section begins with "9/11 conspiracy theorists reject some or all of the following facts about the 9/11 attacks." References, either do not mention conspiracy theories, or make misleading claims such as, "..fires caused the collapse of the Twin Towers and the destruction and damage of other buildings..."

*Suggestion ('''A'''): Update the current background section in accordance with [http://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-14665953 this BBC article] (2011),  for the five most prominent 9/11 conspiracy theories. 
*Suggestion ('''B'''): In particular add the following content based on an edit for two of the BBC's listed conspiracies, ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=9/11_conspiracy_theories&diff=prev&oldid=702995732 read the edit here]).

Either support A and/or B, or oppose the article addition, with a brief explanation why. Use the discussion section to make suggestions and for general input. - [[User:Prokaryotes|prokaryotes]] ([[User talk:Prokaryotes|talk]]) 22:28, 2 February 2016 (UTC)}}

Should a See Also link be included to [[Puerto Rican Day Parade attacks]]?

Please !vote in the Survey section with Yes or No.  Keep threaded discussion in the Threaded Discussion section.  Be civil and concise.  [[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 20:58, 3 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Child abuse#rfc_AEE9469|Talk:Child abuse]] expired 2016-03-04 23:01 ===
* Id: AEE9469
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2016-02-03 22:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|703179611|LANG 703179611}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|703179616|MEDIA 703179616}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|703179618|POL 703179618}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|703179621|SOC 703179621}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|708324512|LANG 708324512}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|708324513|MEDIA 708324513}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|708324515|POL 708324515}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|708324518|SOC 708324518}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is dispute over whether to use [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Child_abuse&diff=703160442&oldid=703158955 this] or [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Child_abuse&diff=703166525&oldid=703164032 this] definition for the [[WP:Lead sentence]] of the [[Child abuse]] article. The latter version is the broader definition. One concern is that since reliable sources say that the definition of child abuse is not always clear, the lead should use the broader wording, especially if it establishes what the words ''abuse'' and ''maltreatment'' mean according to the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) and [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] (CDC). The other concern is that the broader definition is less commonly used, since unintentional harm of a child is often not termed ''child abuse''; because of this, it is therefore misleading to state "any" or "all forms" of harm to a child, especially for things like "neglect" or "exploitation"; the [[Child neglect]] article, for example, makes it very clear that child neglect is commonly difficult to define. 

If receiving this message from the RfC page, see [[Talk:Child abuse#Lead section: WHO definition of child maltreatment]] for more discussion on how to define the lead. Also, [[WP:Med]] and [[WP:Law]] will be alerted to this RfC. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 22:50, 3 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject History/RfC on Third Reich-only military units using Germany or Nazi Germany in infoboxes#rfc_C79C105|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject History/RfC on Third Reich-only military units using Germany or Nazi Germany in infoboxes]] expired 2016-03-05 07:01 ===
* Id: C79C105
* User: Jimbo Wales
* Date: 2016-02-04 06:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|703231764|BIO 703231764}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|703231769|HIST 703231769}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|703231775|POL 703231775}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|703231781|SOC 703231781}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|703231786|STYLE 703231786}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|708378958|BIO 708378958}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|708378961|HIST 708378961}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|708378963|POL 708378963}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|708378966|SOC 708378966}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|708378970|STYLE 708378970}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Notices will be/have been placed on [[WP:GERMANY|WikiProject Germany]], [[WP:MILHIST|WikiProject Military History]], [[WP:WikiProject History|WikiProject History]], the [[WP:NPOV/N|Neutral POV Noticeboard]], and [[User talk:Jimbo Wales|Jimbo's talkpage]] (for the watchers - there are a lot, and this would create a community consensus)

:Should military units active ''only'' during the Third Reich/Nazi Germany-era use in their infoboxes for "Country";
:#{{flagcountry|Nazi Germany}} – says '''Germany''', links to [[Nazi Germany]]
:#{{flag|Nazi Germany}} – says and links to '''Nazi Germany'''
:#{{flag|Nazi Germany|name=Third Reich}} – says '''Third Reich''', links to [[Nazi Germany]]
<small>This will affect articles in [[:Category:Military units and formations of the Luftwaffe]], [[:Category:Military units and formations of the Kriegsmarine]], [[:Category:Military units and formations of the German Army in World War II]], [[:Category:Military units and formations of the Waffen-SS]] and other related articles that may not be listed in these categories.</small>

*There was an earlier 'local consensus' on [[WP:MILHIST|Wikiproject: Military History]] to use (1); discussion found [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Military history/Archive 49#Germany or Nazi Germany?|here, under thread "Germany or Nazi Germany"]]. However, this is an old and very localised consensus that has mostly faded into obscurity. 

*This RfC seeks to create a broader and more consolidated consensus for reasons of consistency across articles. Please !vote by '''bolding''' the preferred number, or word, choice as your !vote with your reasoning for such a selection.<br/> E.g. <code>'''(#)''' because [[WP:POLICY]], [[WP:GUIDELINE]] and I think this and that. <nowiki>~~~~</nowiki></code>

__TOC__ 

'''!Voting'''

<em>Remember to be [[WP:CIVIL|civil]] and [[WP:FOC|focus on the content, not other editors]]</em>

* '''Germany''' (Option 1) is neutral and obvious. Not sure what the evidence is that the existing consensus has "faded into obscurity", rather lack of volatility might make it simply a "settled" consensus. [[User:Alexbrn|Alexbrn]] ([[User talk:Alexbrn|talk]]) 06:22, 4 February 2016 (UTC)}}

==== Basketball teams in Kosovo '''

<div class="boilerplate cfd vfd xfd-closed" style="background:#bff9fc; margin:0 auto; padding:0 10px 0 10px; border:1px solid #AAAAAA;">
:''The following is an archived discussion concerning one or more categories. <span style="color:red">'''Please do not modify it.'''</span> Subsequent comments should be made on an appropriate discussion page (such as the category's [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). === [[Talk:First Anglo-Maratha War#rfc_FFEEB8F|Talk:First Anglo-Maratha War]] expired 2016-03-08 07:01 ===
* Id: FFEEB8F
* User: Xtremedood
* Date: 2016-02-07 06:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|703727245|HIST 703727245}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|703727247|POL 703727247}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|708931104|HIST 708931104}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|708931108|POL 708931108}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I believe that it is well sourced that the outcome of this war was '''indecisive''' and not a "Maratha Victory" as claimed here [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=First_Anglo-Maratha_War&oldid=701588356]. This claim of an indecisive outcome is proven by a variety of academic sources, including the following <ref>{{citation|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=cdXnVOKKkssC&pg=PA226|title=The First Anglo-Maratha War, 1774-1783: A Military Study of Major Battles|page=226|author=M. R. Kantak|others= quote: "Inspite of British superiority in the military science, the British troops could not force a decisive win over the Maratha troops in the First Anglo-Maratha War. The ultimate result of the War  showed that the two sides remained evenly balanced."}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=cYoHOqC7Yx4C&pg=PA290|others=quote: "First Anglo-Maratha War...The war ends inconclusively."|title=Columbia Chronologies of Asian History and Culture|author=John Bowman|page=290|publisher=Columbia University Press}}</ref>. I think that attempts to try and portray this war as a "Maratha Victory" is indicative of a bias, which violates [[WP:NPOV]]. Even the main painting of a British soldier allegedly submitting to the Marathas is unsourced and does not appear to have a historical basis. I would like additional involvement from other users in regards to this matter. [[User:Xtremedood|Xtremedood]] ([[User talk:Xtremedood|talk]]) 06:30, 7 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not#rfc_0AE4250|Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not]] expired 2016-03-08 16:01 ===
* Id: 0AE4250
* User: Herostratus
* Date: 2016-02-07 15:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|703769517|POLICY 703769517}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|708991744|POLICY 708991744}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This proposal is to add films to Subsection 3 of the section '''"Wikipedia is not a mirror or a repository of links, images, or media files"''' (which has shorcuts [[WP:NOTREPOSITORY]], [[WP:NOTLINKFARM]], [[WP:NOTGALLERY]], and others) as shown below. (The bolding is just to highlight the change, it's not intended to be in the actual policy text).

Current text:
:{{xt|Public domain or other source material such as entire books or source code, original historical documents, letters, laws, proclamations, and other source material that are only useful when presented with their original, unmodified wording.}}

Proposed new text:
:{{xt|Public domain or other source material such as entire books '''or films''', or source code, original historical documents, letters, laws, proclamations, and other source material that are only useful when presented with their original, unmodified wording.}}
<small><span class="autosigned">—&nbsp;Preceding comment added by [[User:Herostratus|Herostratus]] ([[User talk:Herostratus|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Herostratus|contribs]]) </span></small>

'''Survey'''

* '''Support''' in general. This does not mean we should avoid links to full PD movies or other media, whether at Commons, Internet Archive, or hosted elsewhere (as long as it's PD), just that when you are putting these within the prose of the article, they do not help to condense the summary approach we are supposed to be giving the reader. Short clips or screencaps of relevant sections embedded in the prose are infinitely more helpful from an encyclopedic standpoint to showcase something that is of discussion in the neighboring prose rather than the full work and telling the reader to go find it themselves. We don't need to include full classic novels to understand those novels from an encyclopedic viewpoint, so the same logic applies with video and audio. --[[User:Masem|M<font size="-3">ASEM</font>]] ([[User Talk:Masem|t]]) 15:24, 7 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox person#rfc_1D9B202|Template talk:Infobox person]] expired 2016-03-11 08:01 ===

* User: Ricky81682

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|704224706|BIO 704224706}}

=== [[Talk:Sallekhana#rfc_9354C87|Talk:Sallekhana]] expired 2016-03-11 17:01 ===
* Id: 9354C87
* User: GideonF
* Date: 2016-02-10 15:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|704284843|UNSORTED 704284843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|709558359|UNSORTED 709558359}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The practice this article refers to meets the English-language definition of suicide, so it is inaccurate to edit the article in such a way as to imply that it is not suicide. That the Jain religion has an alternative conception of suicide that does not encompass Sallekhana that bears mentioning, but it does not justify expunging references to the common English-language conception.[[User:GideonF|GideonF]] ([[User talk:GideonF|talk]]) 15:06, 10 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Rafik Yousef#rfc_CB24082|Talk:Rafik Yousef]] expired 2016-03-13 11:01 ===
* Id: CB24082
* User: AusLondonder
* Date: 2016-02-12 10:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|704591452|POL 704591452}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|704591458|SOC 704591458}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|709836505|POL 709836505}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|709836506|SOC 709836506}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Should the following categories be included in this BIO article? [[:Category:Stabbing attacks in 2015]]	
*[[:Category:2015 crimes in Germany]]	
*[[:Category:Islamic terrorism in Germany]]	
*[[:Category:Terrorist incidents in 2015]]
*[[:Category:21st century in Berlin]]	
*[[:Category:Terror attacks committed by paroled Islamic Terrorists]]	
*[[:Category:Category:Failed terrorist attempts]] (sic)

'''Oppose inclusion''' I do not believe these categories are appropriate for a biography in any conceivable way. For example [[WP:COPDEF]] states "Categorise by characteristics of the person, not characteristics of the article: The most common mistake of this type is adding an article to Category:Biography. That category may legitimately contain articles about biographical films or biographical books, but should not contain articles about individual people. The article is a biography; the person is not" - Yousef was a terrorist. He was not a terrorist incident. He was not a crime. Other guidelines at [[WP:COP]] also seem relevant [[User:AusLondonder|AusLondonder]] ([[User talk:AusLondonder|talk]]) 10:11, 12 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Noticeboard for India-related topics#rfc_BC70D5C|Wikipedia talk:Noticeboard for India-related topics]] expired 2016-03-14 02:01 ===
* Id: BC70D5C
* User: Titodutta
* Date: 2016-02-17 23:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|705663364|PROJ 705663364}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|709950287|PROJ 709950287}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A few months ago, we [[Wikipedia_talk:Noticeboard_for_India-related_topics/Archive_60#.5BProject_WIN.5D_Ideas_and_Opinions|started a discussion]] on starting a few initiatives. After that I talked to a few Indic Wikipedians. Very recently [[User:Vin09]], [[User:Ms Sarah Welch]] and I [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Vin09&oldid=705427954#Brainstorming resumed brainstorming], and also copied some portion from the Meta-Wiki page to [[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/Project WIN|this page]].

Here are a few proposals which should improve a few things of this WikiProject. 
{| class="wikitable" style="width: 100%; text-align: center;"
|-
! colspan=3| A few plans for next 1 month or so
|-
! # !! Planned initiative !! Details
|-
| 1 || Starting "WikiProject India noticeboard star of the month || A barnstar/recognition for the best participant(s) here. It'll encourage more participation
|-
| 2 || Starting regular nomination of Indic English Wikipedians to WP:PRECIOUS, Editor of the week etc || There are multiple special recognitions here such as Wikipedian of the week, precious etc. Nominating best Indic editors there on regular basis.
|-
| 3 || Highlighting on Wikipedia social media channels || Attempt to highlight some of the best Indic En WP works on Wikipedia social channels
|-
| 4 || Edit-a-thon || {{Grey|''Topic, dates unplanned''}}
|}
Please let us know your feedback. Also feel free to suggest new initiatives (but let's not plan something very big right now, IMO). --[[User:Titodutta|Tito Dutta]] ([[User talk:Titodutta|talk]]) 23:07, 17 February 2016 (UTC)}}
Relevant discussions: [[Wikipedia talk:Miscellany for deletion#Grumping about some relistings of MfD discussions.]], [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/IncidentArchive913#MFD relistings]], and [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Incidents#User:SmokeyJoe reverting MFD relistings]].

=== [[Talk:Donetsk People's Republic#rfc_81912AE|Talk:Donetsk People's Republic]] expired 2016-03-14 08:01 ===
* Id: 81912AE
* User: XavierGreen
* Date: 2016-02-13 06:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|704732106|POL 704732106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|704852190|HIST 704852190}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|709985699|HIST 709985699}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For the past several weeks an edit war has been going on over the infobox on this page. A faction of editors are attempting to change the infobox from the country/geopolitical organization infobox to the warfaction one. The relevant discussion regarding this was obscured by taking place in a thread with an irrelevant title here [[Talk:Donetsk_People%27s_Republic#The_DPR_is_comparable_to_ISIS_now]], in which it is apparent no consensus was reached. In an effort to began dispute resolution i am requesting comment from previously uninvolved editors. Do you belive the country/geopolitical faction infobox should be used for this article (as it is on pages of other territorial administrations like [[Rojava]], [[Somaliland]], and [[France]], or do you think the warfaction infobox should be used as it is on pages such as [[Real IRA]] and [[Al Nusra Front]]?[[User:XavierGreen|XavierGreen]] ([[User talk:XavierGreen|talk]]) 06:03, 13 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of current state leaders by date of assumption of office#rfc_CBD8320|Talk:List of current state leaders by date of assumption of office]] expired 2016-03-15 00:01 ===
* Id: CBD8320
* Date: 2016-02-13 23:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|704199167|HIST 704199167}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|704199169|POL 704199169}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|710102240|HIST 710102240}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|710102245|POL 710102245}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Shall we.... <br>
*'''A''') Keep the status quo? <br>
*'''B''') Change the entry criteria to ''sovereign state'' assumption of office date & give Elizabeth II & her realms (4 original states, together & the 12 others in required sections) different entries in the article? <br>
*'''C''') Maintain current entry criteria that allows assumption of office date ''pre-sovereign state'' & change Elizabeth II's entry to ''United Kingdom and Flag'' with footnote for her 15 other states? <br>
*'''D''') Redirect the article to another article? <br>
*'''E''') Maintain current entry criteria that allows the assumption of an office before a state's independence ''and'' add allowance of the assumption of an office created upon a state attaining independence. For Elizabeth II: UK, Canada, Australia, NZ stay as now; remaining 12 realms redistributed throughout whole list according to date of independence/creation of office of head of state.
*'''F''') Sorry to add lately an option: with dates added in the list for each new independent state for Elizabeth II instead of footnotes. [[User:Wykx|<span style="color:#000080">'''Wykx'''</span>]] ([[User_talk:Wykx|talk]]) 23:45, 13 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Debbie Does Dallas#rfc_3B11829|Talk:Debbie Does Dallas]] expired 2016-03-15 05:01 ===
* Id: 3B11829
* User: Herostratus
* Date: 2016-02-14 05:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|704889467|MEDIA 704889467}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|710140594|MEDIA 710140594}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{xt|(See also:[[Talk:A Free Ride#RfC: Replace embedded hardcore pornographic movie with link to Commons?]], on a similar (but not identical) question.}}){{clear}}
The movie ''Debbie Does Dallas'' is in the public domain (according to Commons, although FWIW that's apparently disputed by some parties, but as a general rule we follow what Commons says). So it makes sense to include or link to the film in some way. Two ways have been suggested, and it's been rather contentious with no consensus reached. Asking for more input what say you, fellow editors?
*'''Include it as a click-to-play thumbnail in the body of the article''', below the infobox? or
*'''Include it as a link in the External Links section''', presumably in a Commons icon but with the legend "Full film available at Wikimedia Commons" (with "Full Film" clickable) rather than (or in addition to) the less clear default "Wikimedia Commons has media related to Debbie Does Dallas" (but don't get hung up on the details, please). [[User:Herostratus|Herostratus]] ([[User talk:Herostratus|talk]]) 05:01, 14 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Peyton Manning#rfc_16145DC|Talk:Peyton Manning]] expired 2016-03-15 19:01 ===
* Id: 16145DC
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2016-03-14 18:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|710061769|BIO 710061769}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|710229558|BIO 710229558}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose the following: '''Because of their success''', the Mannings have been described by some as football's "royal family". The current text does explain why they are perceived as the royal family. Including ''Because of their success'' will explain to the reader why they are perceived as the royal family.

One of the sources says "Combine that with a strong work ethic and a love of the game that Archie had instilled in his boys and it's no wonder that Peyton and Eli have been so successful. The result is a legacy that's rarely matched in professional sports. Today, the Mannings have become the country's  royal family of football."[https://books.google.ro/books?id=sEMxOwdj_jkC&printsec=frontcover&dq=country's+royal+family+of+football+page+6&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjy76m597nLAhUY8WMKHX76A6YQ6AEIIjAB#v=onepage&q=country's%20royal%20family%20of%20football&f=false] [[User:QuackGuru|<font color="vermillion">'''QuackGuru'''</font>]] ([[User talk:QuackGuru|<font color="burntorange">talk</font>]]) 18:51, 14 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations#rfc_991EE38|Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations]] expired 2016-03-16 03:01 ===
* Id: 991EE38
* User: Prhartcom
* Date: 2016-03-08 17:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|709001443|STYLE 709001443}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|710294955|STYLE 710294955}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should all of the subcategories of the [[Wikipedia:Good articles/all|Wikipedia:Good articles]] page continue to be placed on the [[Wikipedia:Good article nominations]] page?

The list of good articles (GA) is organized onto ''topics'' (or ''pages''; there are 15 topics/pages), ''subtopics'' (there are 37 subtopics across the topics). From the beginning, all of the topics and subtopics on the good articles page have also all been placed onto the good article nominations (GAN) page.<ref>There are also ''sub-subtopics'' (there are 444 sub-subtopics across the subtopics). ''Sub-subtopics'' from the GA page have never been placed onto the GAN page, except in helpful explanation sentences found under each subtopic. This RfC is not concerned about sub-subtopics.</ref><ref>Naturally, in an ever-expanding encyclopedia, editors improve the categorization on the GA page: never adding topics but occasionally adding subtopics. The last time this was done was to add an additional subtopic ("Classical compositions") to the Music topic and to add seven additional subtopics ("Armies and military units", "Battles, exercises, and conflicts", "Military aircraft", "Military decorations and memorials", "Military people", "Warships and naval units", "Weapons, equipment, and buildings") to the Warfare topic. (The time before that, three years ago in November 2012, the topic name "Theatre, film and drama" was changed to "Media and drama" and the subtopics "Film" and "Television" were created; see [[Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations/Archive 18#Changing Section Headings]].)</ref> 

I propose we add the additional subtopic ("Classical compositions") to the Music topic and to add seven additional subtopics ("Armies and military units", "Battles, exercises, and conflicts", "Military aircraft", "Military decorations and memorials", "Military people", "Warships and naval units", "Weapons, equipment, and buildings") to the Warfare topic. To do so involves editing the GAN page to add the new subtopics and enhancing Legobot to use the new subtopics.<ref>This has not been done; note that the GAN page must be edited first before the enhancements may be added, as the bot inserts articles between specially placed comments on the GAN page.</ref>

Of course, the developer/operator of Legobot, {{u|Legoktm}}, who took over this responsibility in 2012, is invited to this discussion and their input is critical. It appears we haven't yet had a subtopic change under Legoktm's watch.

There are a few other things to consider. First: The GAN page looks odd with empty subtopics and empty subtopics could confuse people, although of course it's only temporary, so we should probably not add them until Legobot is nearly ready to use them. Second: Remember that a subtopic on the GAN page is also a queue in which we wait for our GAN to be reviewed; more subtopics may mean it is not as far from the bottom of the queue to the top. And last: Maybe some other GA/GAN subtopics should also be divided into additional subtopics; for example the "Sports and recreation" subtopic is quite large on the GAN page.<ref>Although new subtopic names are not immediately obvious here.</ref>

Thank-you for your comments. My thanks to {{u|BlueMoonset}} who helped research this. Best, [[User:Prhartcom|Prhartcom]] ([[User talk:Prhartcom|talk]]) 17:08, 8 March 2016 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_47F84F4|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2016-03-16 03:01 ===
* Id: 47F84F4
* User: RGloucester
* Date: 2016-02-25 23:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|706909749|STYLE 706909749}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|706909755|POLICY 706909755}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|710294955|STYLE 710294955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|710294960|POLICY 710294960}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)/Archive_119#Jr._comma_RfC:_Survey an RfC in April 2015], the text of [[MOS:JR]] was amended to allow both the use and omission of commas around the suffix "Jr" in names. In other words, as long as an article is internally consistent, one is allowed to write either {{xt|Martin Luther King, Jr,}} or {{xt|Martin Luther King Jr}}. In recent discussions of the matter, it has come to light that the form with the commas, whilst traditional, has lost ground to the form without them. If one reads [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Comma#In_English:_Commas_used_with_.22Jr.5B..5D.22_and_.22Sr.5B..5D.22 a survey of style guides] done by [[User:SMcCandlish|SMcCandlish]], it becomes apparent that eliminating the comma not only has advantages in terms of readability, but it also is nearly universally recommended across the various varieties of English. Eliminating the comma improves prose readability, fulfilling [[MOS:COMMA]]'s recommendation to reduce comma usage, where it is possible. In addition, it eliminates the necessity of the matching comma, which is often omitted in error or otherwise misused.

Based on these findings, should [[MOS:JR]] be amended to prefer the use of the suffix "Jr" without commas? [[User:RGloucester|<span style="font-family:Monotype Corsiva;font-size:12pt;color:#000000">RGloucester </span>]] — [[User talk:RGloucester|☎]] 23:34, 25 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lavdrim Muhaxheri#rfc_1FAD53E|Talk:Lavdrim Muhaxheri]] expired 2016-03-16 20:01 ===
* Id: 1FAD53E
* User: KewinRozz
* Date: 2016-02-17 23:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|705730512|BIO 705730512}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|710406599|BIO 710406599}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Articles often mention both medial reports from 29 July 2014 about Muhahxeri allegedy appearing on beheading footage from Syria [17] and a warrant from Court of Ferizaj and Interpol from the 6 September 2014 in the same articles but they don’t claim that the warrant is issued for the alleged beheading footage [17]; ‘The demand comes from the Basic Court of Ferizaj, which has issued a warrant for Muhaxheri after he is accused of terrorism and organized groups to go to Syria and Iraq’ [17]'. Published court records on 15 January 2016 only mention text messages as evidence for recruitment.[65] The question is about formulation of medial claims in regard to NPOV; avoid stating opinions as facts; shouldn't ‘On 29 July 2014 Muhaxheri uploaded photos to a Facebook page where he is seen beheading an unidentified young man in Syria.’(1/2) (2/3) be stated as 'According to Balkan media, on 29 July 2014 an individual posted two (2) images to a Facebook page under the pseudonym "Lavdrim Muhaxheri" ( it's questioned which published  footage is of Muhaxheri [11]) that, to some extent, give the impression of a man having beheaded an unidentified young man.' or something to the effect of a neutral statement where it's mentioned who's claiming it?

(1/2)https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lavdrim_Muhaxheri&diff=prev&oldid=700631550 (2/3)https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lavdrim_Muhaxheri&diff=prev&oldid=700798610


[[User:KewinRozz|KewinRozz]] [[User:KewinRozz|KewinRozz]] ([[User talk:KewinRozz|talk]]) 23:09, 17 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Australian head of state dispute#rfc_FE9F7A2|Talk:Australian head of state dispute]] expired 2016-03-16 21:01 ===
* Id: FE9F7A2
* User: Skyring
* Date: 2016-02-15 20:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|705663352|POL 705663352}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|710415067|POL 710415067}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article was created in 2011 as an expansion of a section in the [[Government of Australia]] article. It has been much discussed and modified in that time, but has remained essentially stable for several years. Summarising the lede:
* the term head of state does not appear in the Australian constitution (or any other law)
* there is a disagreement among Australians centred on the question of whether the monarch or the governor-general is the country's head of state
* the disagreement has involved viceroys, politicians, legal scholars, and the media
* the question was most prominently debated in the context of an Australian republic at the Australian Constitutional Convention 1998
* it has recurrently been discussed in publications before and since.

Two new editors have raised questions about the validity of the article, and several options have emerged. How should we proceed?
# The article is rubbish. The Queen is the Australian head of state and any statements to the contrary are errors or misunderstandings. The article should be removed entirely.
# The article is mostly rubbish. A few prominent Australians and sections of the media claim the Governor-General is the head of state, but this is a fringe theory. The article should be merged into other articles.
# The article is well sourced and describes the situation accurately. It is notable because few (if any) other nations dispute the identity of their head of state. It should be retained and improved.
--[[User:Skyring|Pete]] ([[User talk:Skyring|talk]]) 20:41, 15 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Alt-right#rfc_9BD7770|Talk:Alt-right]] expired 2016-03-19 00:01 ===
* Id: 9BD7770
* User: Maunus
* Date: 2016-03-06 17:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|708629701|POL 708629701}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|708629705|SOC 708629705}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|713752096|POL 713752096}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|713752103|SOC 713752103}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The term seems to be tied entirely to Spencer's website "Alternative Right". Which perhaps presents itself as the center of a movnment, but which is not described as such by the sources. For that reason I suggest we merge this article to the article on Richard B. Spencer.[[User:Maunus|·maunus]] · [[User talk:Maunus|snunɐɯ·]] 17:13, 6 March 2016 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
There appear to be three possible versions of the characterisation of this party:
# Right-wing
# Far-right
# Right-wing, often characterised as far-right
All are defensible based on sources, so we need to establish the consensus as to which, exactly, should be used, and put this dispute to bed. <b>[[User Talk:JzG|Guy]]</b> <small>([[User:JzG/help|Help!]])</small> 14:53, 18 February 2016 (UTC)}}

Now, should we [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fajr_decade&diff=705290909&oldid=705246406 remove] the events of those days? * Id: C311A55
* Date: 2016-03-01 01:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|707665843|BIO 707665843}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|711076839|BIO 711076839}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The proposed edit is [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Trump%3A_The_Art_of_the_Deal&type=revision&diff=707063241&oldid=707052558 here] (left side) with the current version on the right. Specifically should this sentence (or some variation) be included:

:<code>Journalist [[Tony Schwartz (The Energy Project)|Tony Schwartz]] has claimed that Trump's involvement in the project was limited to reading the final version before it was published on November 1, 1987 by [[Warner Books]]. (Source: https://twitter.com/tonyschwartz/status/644304700884582400 )</code>

In the discussion space below please leave a comment or !vote '''Support''' for inclusion or '''Oppose'''. Per [[WP:RFC]] discussions usually remain open for about a month. 

Additional sources listed in previous talk section above (note the books.google link is to a vanity press publisher). -- [[User:Green Cardamom|<font color="#006A4E">'''Green'''</font>]][[User_talk:Green Cardamom|<font color="#009933">'''C'''</font>]] 01:34, 1 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Time Person of the Year#rfc_C49275C|Talk:Time Person of the Year]] expired 2016-03-21 02:01 ===

* User: GoodDay

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|705874933|POL 705874933}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The country column in the article for Elizabeth II's entry. Which version should we go with.
*1) No countries or flags, with footnote explaining why
*2) {{Flag|United Kingdom}} and the other [[Commonwealth realm|Commonwealth realms]]
*3) No countries or flags, but showing '''Commonwealth realms'''
*4) {{Flag|United Kingdom}} {{Flag|Canada}} {{Flag|Australia}}  {{Flag|New Zealand}} {{Flag|Ceylon}} {{Flag|Pakistan}}  {{Flag|South Africa}}
*5) Delete the country column from the article. Article is based on the individuals & not their country. It also removes dispute, over which of the other 5 options should be implemented.
*6) {{Flag|United Kingdom}}
*7) [[United Kingdom]] and the other [[Commonwealth realm|Commonwealth realms]] [i.e., same as #2, without the flag]
[[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]] ([[User talk:GoodDay|talk]]) 01:05, 20 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Campus sexual assault#rfc_EF0264B|Talk:Campus sexual assault]] expired 2016-03-21 05:01 ===
* Id: EF0264B
* User: Nblund
* Date: 2016-02-21 20:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|706171065|POL 706171065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|711428078|POL 711428078}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is an ongoing dispute regarding the [[Campus_sexual_assault#Criticism|criticisms]] subsection. Specifically, editors have objected to the bulleted list section that details several lawsuits filed by men who were expelled from universities after being accused of sexual assault. The most recent discussion is [[Talk:Campus_sexual_assault#Undue_weight_for_criticism_section|here]]. Generally, the suggested changes are to either:

*1. Leave the bulleted list unchanged, and add a roughly equal amount of detail on cases filed against universities by accusers. 

or 

*2. Offer a couple of short summary statements that address the recent increase in lawsuits filed by students accused of sexual assault without focusing on specific cases. 

Please place comments or preferences below, and feel free to suggest alternate wordings of these options or add more as needed. [[User:Nblund|Nblund]] ([[User talk:Nblund|talk]]) 20:40, 21 February 2016 (UTC)}}

Although this article concerns a worldwide organisation, it was founded in Britain in 1865 by a British Methodist preacher, and is still headquartered in the UK (it waited another 15 years before opening up in the US). Although not a major issue, I do think this should be in British English, rather than the current American variant. – [[User:SchroCat|SchroCat]] ([[User talk:SchroCat|talk]]) 10:06, 21 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability#rfc_77823A2|Wikipedia talk:Notability]] expired 2016-03-22 19:01 ===
* Id: 77823A2
* User: A2soup
* Date: 2016-02-28 21:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|707439019|POLICY 707439019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|711412344|POLICY 711412344}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently significant disagreement at [[WP:MfD|MfD]] about whether [[WP:GNG|GNG]] (and notability guidelines in general) applies to userspace and draftspace drafts. A look at the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Miscellany_for_deletion&oldid=707430963 current slate of MfD discussions] shows this disagreement clearly. 

The question for this RfC is: ''do notability guidelines apply to drafts in userspace or draftspace?'' If you think they apply in one namespace and not the other, please specify in your comment. [[User:A2soup|A2soup]] ([[User talk:A2soup|talk]]) 21:56, 28 February 2016 (UTC)}}

* Id: CFC2322
* User: Xaosflux
* Date: 2016-02-22 14:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{rfcquote|text=
I boldly removed ANRFC, and got reverted - so talk time!  I propose we STOP transcluding [[WP:ANRFC]] to this page.  There are plenty of places to check on the backlogs, including that dedicated noticeboard.  I think this clutters up this page too much, and makes it hard to read, especially from mobile browsers. I would be in favor of some sort of "status box" (perhaps bot maintained) on [[WP:AN]] to make it easy to see the backlog.  Ping to [[User:Lugnuts|Lugnuts]], who encouraged more discussion here. — [[User:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#FF9933; font-weight:bold; font-family:monotype;">xaosflux</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#00FF00;">Talk</span>]]</sup> 14:47, 22 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section#rfc_AAC1EA7|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section]] expired 2016-03-23 21:01 ===
* Id: AAC1EA7
* User: BeenAroundAWhile
* Date: 2016-02-22 20:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|706368890|HIST 706368890}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|706368894|STYLE 706368894}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|711601897|HIST 711601897}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|711601904|STYLE 711601904}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In what way should the [[WP:Lead]] sentence of articles dealing with [[Train station|railway stations or train stations]] be fashioned? Choose one or both of the paragraphs below, or fashion one of your own and post it in an appropriate place). Tell why you prefer your choice and work for a [[WP:Consensus]] if at all possible. (Note: The word ''station'' or its equivalent is normally ''already included'' in the [[WP:Title]] of the article.)

'''1. Name of station followed by word ''station'' in the lead'''

* The '''Abada railway station''' in the [[India]]n [[States and territories of India|state]] of [[West Bengal]], serves [[Abada, India]], in [[Howrah district]]. It is on the Howrah-Kharagpur line. It is {{convert|18|km|mi|0|abbr=on}} from [[Howrah Station]].

* '''Aosta railway station''' ({{lang-it|Stazione di Aosta}}; {{lang-fr|Gare d'Aoste}}) is the [[central station|main station]] serving the city and ''[[comune]]'' of [[Aosta]], in the [[autonomous regions with special statute|autonomous]] [[Regions of Italy|region]] of [[Aosta Valley]], [[Northwest Italy|northwestern Italy]]. 
 
* '''Culver City station''' of the [[Los Angeles County Metro Rail]] system is on the northeast edge of [[Culver City, California]].

'''2. Name of station only in the lead'''

* '''Abada''' is a railway station in the [[India]]n [[States and territories of India|state]] of [[West Bengal]], serving [[Abada, India]], in [[Howrah district]]. It is on the Howrah-Kharagpur line. It is {{convert|18|km|mi|0|abbr=on}} from [[Howrah Station]].

* '''Aosta''' is the [[central station|main station]] serving the city and ''[[comune]]'' of [[Aosta]], in the [[autonomous regions with special statute|autonomous]] [[Regions of Italy|region]] of [[Aosta Valley]], [[Northwest Italy|northwestern Italy]]. 

* '''Culver City''' is an [[Elevated railway|elevated]] [[light rail]] [[Metro station|station]] in the [[Los Angeles County Metro Rail|Los Angeles Metro]] system located at the northeast edge of [[Culver City, California]].

[[User:BeenAroundAWhile|BeenAroundAWhile]] ([[User talk:BeenAroundAWhile|talk]]) 20:56, 22 February 2016 (UTC)}}

I am doing a RfC for the conversation located above.  This section is just a continuation of what has already been started and an attempt to get other voices in the conversation. === [[Talk:2016 in American television#rfc_E32B6D8|Talk:2016 in American television]] expired 2016-03-24 17:01 ===
* Id: E32B6D8
* User: Electricburst1996
* Date: 2016-02-23 16:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|706493128|UNSORTED 706493128}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|711750539|UNSORTED 711750539}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should "person of color" be changed to "black woman"? There's been a persistent edit war between registered users and an IP-hopping editor over this issue.

Arguments in favor of:
*More specific
*[[WP:NOTCENSORED|Wikipedia is not censored]]

Arguments against:
*Racist

In short, I want you guys to vote "yes" or "no." [[User:Electricburst1996|<font color="000FF">Electric</font>]][[User:Electricburst1996|<font color="00FFFF">Burst</font>]]<sup>([[User talk:Electricburst1996|Electron firings]])</sup><sub>([[Special:Contributions/Electricburst1996|Zaps]])</sub> 16:44, 23 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Man Who Sold the World (album)#rfc_5C337A4|Talk:The Man Who Sold the World (album)]] expired 2016-03-24 20:01 ===
* Id: 5C337A4
* User: Dan56
* Date: 2016-02-23 19:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently, the original 1970 American cover was removed from the "Cover" field of the infobox (having been there [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Man_Who_Sold_the_World_(album)&oldid=558862264 since June 2013]) in favor of the 1971 British cover, with no rationale offered ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Man_Who_Sold_the_World_%28album%29&type=revision&diff=699649350&oldid=699643427 13 January 2016]). === [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_C4617C5|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2016-03-25 19:01 ===
* Id: C4617C5
* User: SSTflyer
* Date: 2016-03-20 15:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|711042619|MEDIA 711042619}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|711042627|STYLE 711042627}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|711042631|POLICY 711042631}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|716057952|MEDIA 716057952}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|716057957|STYLE 716057957}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|716057960|POLICY 716057960}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
When a song or album is the only song or album to have a standalone article on Wikipedia, but other songs or albums of the same name are listed on the disambiguation page for that name per [[MOS:DABMENTION]], should the article title of the notable song or album include the artist name?

Some songs and albums are the only song or album with its name to meet notability guidelines and have an article on Wikipedia, but other songs or albums of the same name are listed on the disambiguation page per [[MOS:DABMENTION]]. The current situation on the inclusion of artist names in article titles is inconsistent. A few examples of no artist names in article titles include [[Umbrella (song)]], [[Pillowtalk (song)]], and [[Anti (album)]]; they are the only songs and albums of their names to be notable enough for a standalone article on Wikipedia, although there are other non-notable songs/albums of the same name listed at [[Umbrella (disambiguation)#Songs]], [[Pillow talk (disambiguation)#Songs]], and [[Anti#Music]] respectively. A few examples of artist names in article titles include [[Chandelier (Sia song)]], [[Blackstar (David Bowie song)]], and [[Title (Meghan Trainor album)]]; similarly, they are the only songs and albums of their names to be notable enough for a standalone article on Wikipedia, but [[Chandelier (song)]], [[Blackstar (song)]] and [[Title (album)]] redirect to disambiguation pages, where other non-notable songs/albums of the same name are listed. [[WP:PRECISION]] states {{tq|According to the above-mentioned precision criterion, when a more detailed title is necessary to distinguish an article topic from another, use only as much additional detail as necessary.}} [[WP:NCM]] states {{tq|Use further disambiguation only when needed (for example X (American band), X (Australian band)).}} The dispute arises on whether non-notable songs and albums that lack standalone articles can be considered "article topics". I think we can all agree that the current inconsistency is not ideal, and I am starting a request for comment for a result that should apply to most usual cases. [[User talk:SSTflyer|<span style="color:DarkSlateGray">sst✈</span>]] 15:21, 20 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_9B7E5B2|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2016-03-25 19:01 ===
* Id: 9B7E5B2
* User: Ivanvector#top
* Date: 2016-02-24 17:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|706680019|STYLE 706680019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|706680021|POLICY 706680021}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|711923015|STYLE 711923015}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|711923017|POLICY 711923017}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does the [[WP:TITLECHANGES]] section on changing the national variety of English in an article title need to be clarified?

Article titles which have to choose between two national varieties of English (Yogurt vs. Yoghurt, Color vs. Colour, Humor vs. Humour, and so on) are often subject to perennial move discussions which are often lengthy, contentious, and brutal wastes of time as they rarely resolve anything. Our manual of style currently says, "{{green|If an article title has been stable for a long time, and there is no good reason to change it, it should not be changed. [...] If it has never been stable, or it has been unstable for a long time, and no consensus can be reached on what the title should be, default to the title used by the first major contributor after the article ceased to be a stub.}}" I think the point that needs to be clarified is what makes a title "stable": editors disagree whether stable means "not moved" versus "no move discussions". Or perhaps "default to the title used by the first major contributor..." is being interpreted as a "good reason to change it", absent any other reasons.

The problem this creates is being exemplified in yet another move discussion at [[Talk:Humour]] where it's been suggested that the title is unstable because of the repeated move discussions over a long period (the page has actually been at this title since 13 May 2007), and as a result it's being argued that the "default to the title used by the first major contributor after the article ceased to be a stub" applies, and then there is debate about which version is the first non-stub version. I would like to see that confusion resolved one way or the other, but I'm not sure how to do it, and I don't know what the original intent was.

I suggest these changes (marked up as best I could):
*to [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style#Retaining the existing variety]]: {{green|When no English variety has been established and discussion cannot resolve the issue, the variety used in the first <s>non-stub</s> revision is considered the default. If no English variety was used consistently, the tie is broken by the first <s>post-stub</s> contributor to introduce text written in a particular English variety.}}
*to [[Wikipedia:Article titles#Considering title changes]]: {{green|If an article title has <s>been stable</s><u>not been changed</u> for a long time, and there is no <s>good</s><u>other</u> reason to change it, it should not be changed. [...] If <s>it has never been stable, or it has been unstable for a long time, and<s> no consensus can be reached on what the title should be, <s>default to the title used by the first major contributor after the article ceased to be a stub</s>the tie is broken by the first contributor to introduce test written in a particular English variety.}}

I think these changes will help to resolve conflicts about which variety to use, so that we don't go back and forth endlessly and have editors repeatedly bringing up the same move proposals over and over again. Thoughts? [[User:Ivanvector|Ivanvector]]&nbsp;<span style="color:red">🍁</span>&nbsp;([[User talk:Ivanvector#top|talk]]) 17:21, 24 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Vladimir Solovyov (philosopher)#rfc_7DD2656|Talk:Vladimir Solovyov (philosopher)]] expired 2016-03-26 06:01 ===
* Id: 7DD2656
* User: LoveMonkey
* Date: 2016-03-01 14:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|707742876|BIO 707742876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|711993890|BIO 711993890}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is no proof what so ever in Russia that anyone in Russia academia or otherwise refers to Vladimir Solovyov as Roman Catholic. Solovyev remained Russian Orthodox his whole life and died and is buried in a Russian Orthodox Monastery as an Orthodox Christian [http://www.m-necropol.ru/soloviev.html]. Solovyov did not profess in any of his writings or works that he was Roman Catholic nor did he stated that he did not want to be buried in an Orthodox Monastery as an Orthodox Christian. Putting such undue weight on non peer reviewed sources that contradict reality are not up to form for Wikipedia. [[User:LoveMonkey|LoveMonkey]] ([[User talk:LoveMonkey|talk]]) 14:47, 1 March 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Images#rfc_D1E5A84|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Images]] expired 2016-03-26 20:01 ===
* Id: D1E5A84
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2016-02-25 19:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|706875154|POLICY 706875154}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|712076945|POLICY 712076945}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This WP:RfC concerns how much detail to include in the first paragraph of the [[WP:PERTINENCE]] section of the [[WP:Manual of Style/Images]] guideline. Some editors feel that more is better for clarity and precision, especially for newbie or otherwise less inexperienced editors; other editors feel that more is not necessary, especially if it has the effect of underestimating our editors' intelligence. There is also sentiment that retaining the [[WP:STATUSQUO]] version is best. For those reading this RfC from the RfC page or their user talk page (via an alert), see the [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Images#WP:PERTINENCE section]] and [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Images#Opinions solicited]] subsections for more detail. The below proposals are from those sections, with the last two being subsequent edits made to the guideline page. Feel free to support more than one proposal. I will alert [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style]] and [[WP:Village pump (policy)]] to this discussion. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 19:21, 25 February 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of programs broadcast by Adult Swim#rfc_7F013F2|Talk:List of programs broadcast by Adult Swim]] expired 2016-03-27 03:01 ===
* Id: 7F013F2
* User: Electricburst1996
* Date: 2016-02-26 02:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|706934891|MEDIA 706934891}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this list be re-formatted to be more consistent with other "list of programs broadcast by X" articles? What I suggest here is that we abandon the "description" parameter in the tables and arrange the article sections like so:

-Currently broadcast<br>
--First-run original programming<br>
--Acquired/syndicated programming<br>
--Re-runs of ended original programming<br>
-Future programming<br>
--Original programming<br>
--Acquired/syndicated programming<br>
-Former programming<br>
--Original programming<br>
--Acquired/syndicated programming<br>
---Borrowed for broadcast<br>
-Pilots and specials<br>
--Pilots<br>
--Original specials<br>
--Syndicated shorts/specials<br>
-Films<br>
-References<br>
-External links

=== [[Talk:Johann Sebastian Bach#rfc_6E72E14|Talk:Johann Sebastian Bach]] expired 2016-03-27 18:01 ===
* Id: 6E72E14
* User: Fountains-of-Paris
* Date: 2016-02-26 17:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|707047447|BIO 707047447}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|707047457|HIST 707047457}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|707047462|MEDIA 707047462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|707047465|RELI 707047465}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|707047468|SOC 707047468}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|712207684|BIO 712207684}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|712207689|HIST 712207689}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|712207692|MEDIA 712207692}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|712207693|RELI 712207693}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|712207696|SOC 712207696}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A previous RfC had 3 supporting editors for changing the current arbitrary century marker dates to important benchmark dates in the Bach Legacy time-line, with 2 editors opposed which resulted in deadlock. The current chronology of the Bach Legacy section is arbitrarily organized by century markers like 1800, 1900, 2000, etc, rather than specific important dates directly relevant to the Bach Legacy section. Another RfC (see above on Talk page) has identified 1829 (the date of the Mendelssohn Bach revival) as being of heightened importance to understanding the Bach Legacy as a whole. Mendelssohn worked extensively to revive Bach's reputation between 1824-1829 with the revived performance of Bach's Matthew Passion in Germany in 1829. The dates in the Bach chronology should reflect this in a new and enhanced outline covering first, '''1750-1829''', followed by '''1830-1899''', etc, leaving the rest of the section unchanged at this time. This RfC is to determine SUPPORT or OPPOSE for the enhanced specification of the benchmark dates over and against the use of arbitrary century markers currently used in the Bach Legacy section. [[User:Fountains-of-Paris|Fountains-of-Paris]] ([[User talk:Fountains-of-Paris|talk]]) 17:11, 26 February 2016 (UTC)}}
